summary:
My research focuses on the history and development of the academic study of Gnosticism; its impact on Euro-American modern thought; and appropriation in twentieth-century religion, philosophy, and (popular) culture. 

Besides doing research, I am also interested in mentoring, mental health, (neuro-)diversity, and creativity.

I am always eager to explore new ways of thinking, foster productive discussions, and develop innovative ideas with people from varied backgrounds. To unlock the creative power of diversity, I concentrate on promoting inclusive practices and building a safe environment, in which everyone can feel accepted, respected, and heard.

awards.title: Hans Jonas’ s Reception of Gnosticism and Existentialism
awards.description:
10 weeks research stay at the Royal Netherlands Institute in Rome (May-August). 

The research focused on the reception of Gnosticism and existentialism in Hans Jonas's postwar thought. 

Main hypothesis tested: 	Jonas did not study Gnosticism as a historical entity but constructed it through contemporary frameworks, particularly existentialism, as a diagnostic tool to articulate the nature of the crisis of modernity.

Approaches
Philosophical, historical, comparative, intertextual

Results
chapter of PhD thesis

Principal investigator: Fryderyk Kwiatkowski
Supervision: prof. Stefano Bancalari, Sapienza University; prof. Emidio Spinelli, Sapienza University; 
prof. Irene Kajon, Sapienza University
awards.issuer: Royal Netherlands Institute in Rome (KNIR) and Wessel Ganzevoort Funds scholarship

projects.title: The reception of Gnosticism in postwar American culture in view of the theories of Hans Jonas, Carl G. Jung and Eric Voegelin. Examination of study cases representing various types of media and forms of public statements
projects.description:
Goal
The goal of the project was to provide a historical overview of the reception of the idea of "Gnosticism" in postwar American public discourse. The analysis concentrated on how selected academic conceptions of Gnosticism determined the reception of the term in philosophy, popular scholarship, religion, fiction, news, and documentaries.

Tasks
1)	evaluation of the scholarly literature
2)	analysis of primary sources (fiction and non-fiction) representing various types of media: novels, films, comic books, popular scholarship, news magazines, documentaries
3)	collection of obtained results 
4)	data interpretation

Approaches
historical, comparative, reception

Results
chapter of PhD thesis

Principal investigator: Fryderyk Kwiatkowski
Supervision: prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta
Place: Faculty of Theology of the University of Groningen
Funding agency: Faculty of Philosophy of the Jagiellonian University
Grant no. K/DSC/005587
The project was part of PhD research

projects.title: The reception of Gnosticism in the United States after the discovery of the Nag Hammadi Library. The critical analysis and comparison of the concepts of Gnosticism of Hans Jonas, Carl G. Jung, and Eric Voegelin
projects.description:
Goal
1)	reconstruction of commonalities and differences between selected academic conceptions of Gnosticism
2)	assessment of their impact on the development of postwar American reception of Gnosticism and its place in philosophy, religion, culture


Tasks
1)	investigation of primary and secondary sources on the conceptions
2)	survey of scholarly sources on the reception of Gnosticism in postwar America within the broader context of philosophy, religion, culture
3)	comparative analysis of the conceptions, particularly ideological agendas of their authors, research methods used, philosophical goals, sources , definitions of concepts, conclusions, authors’ biographies and intellectual influences
4)	collection of results from 1 and 2
5)  reconstruction of conceptual framework shared by all conceptions

Approaches
philosophical, historical, comparative, reception

Results
chapter of PhD thesis

Principal investigator: Fryderyk Kwiatkowski
Supervision: prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta
Place: Faculty of Theology of the University of Groningen
Funding agency: Faculty of Philosophy of the Jagiellonian University
no. K/DSC/004786
The project was part of PhD research

projects.title: Gnostic ideas in Hollywood. The problem of researching narrative fiction in light of the contemporary approaches in Gnostic studies
projects.description:
Goal
1)	construction of typology of the most recurrent factual errs and methodological issues present in the studies on the reception of Gnosticism in fiction (films, novels, computer games, comic books)
2)	proposition of new theoretical models for studying the reception of Gnosticism in fiction, based on recent developments in Gnostic studies

Tasks
1)	evaluation of the literature on recent methods and approaches in Gnostic studies
2)	revision of scholarly publications in the field of literary studies and film studies on the reception of Gnosticism in light of the results from (1)
3)	collecting results from (1) and (2) in the form of scholarly papers

Approaches
philosophical, methodological, historical, textual, reception

Results
1) Kwiatkowski Fryderyk, About the Concept of “Gnosticism” in Fiction Studies, [in:] “CLCWeb: Comparative Literature and Culture,” 2016, 3 (18), pp. 1-8 
https://doi.org/10.7771/1481-4374.2997.
2) Kwiatkowski Fryderyk, A Critical Analysis of the Concept of “Gnosticism” in Polish Literary Studies, [in:] “Canadian-American Slavic Studies”, 2018, 1 (52), pp. 50-66 http://booksandjournals.brillonline.com/content/journals/10.1163/22102396-05201003

Principal investigator: Fryderyk Kwiatkowski
Supervision: prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta
Place: Faculty of Theology of the University of Groningen
Funding agency: Faculty of Philosophy of the Jagiellonian University
no. K/DSC/00408

projects.title: The ways of representing Gnosticism in Hollywood films of the 1990s
projects.description:
The main goal of the project was to identify which ideas most typically associated with the concept of Gnosticism were depicted in Hollywood films of the 1990s, e.g. "The Truman Show" (1998), "Dark City" (1998), "The Matrix" (1999).

Tasks
1)	critical evaluation of the scholarly literature on the affinities between Gnosticism and film (library query)
2)	examination of a selected group of films
3)	collecting results from 1 and 2 in the form of scholarly papers

Approaches
comparative, historical, textual, intertextual, narratological, reception 

Results
1) chapter of PhD thesis
2) Kwiatkowski Fryderyk, How To Attain Liberation From a False World? The Gnostic Myth of Sophia in Dark City (1998), [in:] “Journal of Religion and Film,” 2017, 1 (21), pp. 1-33
http://digitalcommons.unomaha.edu/jrf/vol21/iss1/34/
3) Kwiatkowski Fryderyk, CINEMA: evil demiurges in Hollywood films at the threshold of the twenty-first century, [in:] Garry W. Trompf, Gunner B. Mikkelsen, Jay Johnston (eds.), The Gnostic World, London: Routledge, pp. 679-687

Principal investigator: Fryderyk Kwiatkowski
Supervision: prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta 
Place: Faculty of Theology of the University of Groningen 
Funding agency: Faculty of Philosophy of the Jagiellonian University 
no. K/DSC/003401
The project was part of PhD research

profile_positions.description:
Joint-PhD position at the Institute of Philosophy of the Jagiellonian University and at the Faculty of Theology and Religious Studies of the University of Groningen. 

My doctoral project investigates the reception of Gnosticism in twentieth-century Euro-American thought and Hollywood films of the 1990s.

Supervisors 
prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta, University of Groningen
dr hab. Joanna Hańderek, prof. JU, Jagiellonian University

profile_positions.description:
I did four traineeships at the Faculty of Theology and Religious Studies of the University of Groningen. The internships were part of my PhD training. The internships were undertaken during the following periods:

01.03.2017 - 30.06.2017
20.05.2018 - 20.08.2018
01.12.2018 - 31.01.2019
02.02.2019 - 01.04.2019

Tasks
1)	Preparation and coordination of the practical part of the course “Ancient Mythology in Modern Intellectual History”, BA International Studies, 6-week block, 15 students, activities: introductory lectures, moderating discussions, assessing students’ papers, giving feedback
2)	Editing service in the project “Nag Hammadi Bibliography Online,” Brill
3)	Editing service for “Gnosis: Journal of Gnostic Studies,” Brill
4)	Participation in research seminar groups on Early Christianity and Graduate School meetings at the Faculty of Theology and Religious Studies of the University of Groningen
5)	Completion of a library queries at the University of Groningen, studying scholarly publications on Gnosticism and fiction.
6)	Completion of Dutch language courses toward B1 level

Funding agency: ERASMUS+ Traineeship Grants
Supervisor: prof. dr. Lautaro Roig Lanzillotta
profile_positions.title: Trainee
